title.native: ストライク・ザ・ブラッド

description:
The Fourth Primogenitor—That's the world's strongest vampire that should only exist in legends. Accompanied by twelve Kenjuu and spreading calamity, this phantom vampire appeared in Japan. For the observation and obliteration of this Fourth Primogenitor, the government and Lion King decided to dispatch an attack mage known as a Sword Shaman. However, for some reason, the one chosen for the observation was a apprentice Sword Shaman girl, Himegari Yukina. Wielding the strongest anti-primogenitor spirit spear, Yukina arrived at Demon District, Itogami City. What is the true identity of the Fourth Primogenitor, Akatsuki Kojou, she encountered over there!?

(Source: Baka-Tsuki, edited)
synonyms: ราชันย์โลหิตรัตติกาล

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

node.description:
__[Website](https://kisidakyoudan.com/)__ | __[Website (Warner Bros Japan)](https://whv-amusic.com/kisidakyoudan/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kisida_info)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kisidakyoudan/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl7OsED7y9eavZJbTGnK0xg/videos)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kisidakyodan/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1zPnpAM7fGFr7pl8OSNvak?si=ZPjWJdhFSR-cVEZHiynphQ)__ | __[Spotify (kishidakyoudan)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0V8dBE2G0SkXl7GoWnflOk?si=95X396W9RLCizLym_eGy2A)__

__Introduction:__
Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets is a Japanese rock band under record label Warner Bros Home Entertainment (2013–), having previously been under Geneon Universal (2010–2011). The band initially formed as a one-man unit under the name Kishida Kyoudan (stylized as kishidakyoudan) in 2004. The band made its independent debut in 2005 with the album SUPERNOVA, while still continuing to release the next four albums under the name Kishida Kyoudan, before changing their name to Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets in 2007.

__Biography:__
The band began in 2004 as a one-man unit consisting of the musician Kishida, who dedicated his time to cover songs from various series. One prominent series which he covered a lot was the Touhou Project, in addition to  other video games by Japanese visual novel studio [Key](http://key.visualarts.gr.jp/). He would go on to release a CD in 2005 featuring original songs and covers of various songs from the Type-Moon games and the Touhou Project, which he featured for sale at the Winter Comiket in the same year.

In 2007, Kishida received a request to perform at the Touhou live event "Flowering Night", he accepted and gathered various members regardless of personality or experience to form the unit "Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets". They originally planned to disband after performing at the event, but due to unexpected positive feedback from the audience they decided to continue as a band. Later, in the same year, the vocalist ichigo also joined the band.

The band made their major debut in July 2010 through NBCUniversal Entertainment (who at the time were known as Geneon Universal), performing the single titled "HIGHSCHOOL OF THE DEAD" in the anime with the same name _[HIGHSCHOOL OF THE DEAD](https://anilist.co/anime/8074/Gakuen-Mokushiroku-HIGHSCHOOL-OF-THE-DEAD/)_. The full single was released a month later on August 18, 2010, which was their first single release as Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets, which was a whole three years after officially starting band activities. Additionally their first album titled "POPSENSE" was released a year later on June 22, 2011, spanning a total of eleven tracks.

Skipping three years ahead to 2013, the band would make its reappearance in anime performing the single titled "STRIKE THE BLOOD" to the show with the same name _[STRIKE THE BLOOD](https://anilist.co/anime/18277/Strike-the-Blood/)_, while on December 24, 2014 they would release their second album titled "hack/SLASH", which also spanned a total of eleven tracks.

In 2015, on July 5, and in the following year 2016, on January 9, the band would make two consecutive appearances in the anime _[GATE](https://anilist.co/anime/20994/Gate-Jieitai-Kanochi-nite-Kaku-Tatakaeri/)_, and its sequel _[GATE II](https://anilist.co/anime/21364/Gate-Jieitai-Kanochi-nite-Kaku-Tatakaeri-2/)_, performing the singles "GATE (Sore wa Akatsuki no You ni)" and  "GATE II (Sekai o Koete)". The full versions of the singles released on July 29, 2015 and on January 27, 2016 respectively. They would, in addition, go on to make two more appearances in anime in 2016, with the first one being in _[Alderamin on the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/21410/Nejimaki-Seirei-Senki-Tenkyou-no-Alderamin/)_ on July 9, performing the single "Tenkyou no Alderamin" and on November 23, performing the single "BLOOD ON THE EDGE", in the show _[Strike the Blood II](https://anilist.co/anime/21815/Strike-the-Blood-II/)_.

__Members:__
- [Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/153287/Kishida) (岸田) – bassist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [ichigo](https://anilist.co/staff/257500/Ichigo) – vocalist
- [Hayapi](https://twitter.com/hayapi_san_V3) (はやぴ～) – lead guitarist
- [Micchan](https://twitter.com/MI_CYAN_GOGO) (みっちゃん) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- [T-tsu](https://twitter.com/t_tsu8) (てっ), also known as T-tsu-chan (てっちゃん) – guitarist

__[Website](https://www.tsubasanium.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasacurry)__ 

__Tsubasa Itou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福田道生)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Debuted as a director on [Hyakko](https://anilist.co/anime/4550/).

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__Formed:__ 2013

__Introduction:__
Assumed Sounds is a collaboration between musicians for the anime series Strike The Blood.

__Members:__
- Shouta Horie (堀江晶太)
- Ryouta Kikuchi (菊池亮太)
- Naoki "naotyu-" Chiba (千葉直樹)
- Susumu "satsuki" Akizuki (秋月須清)
- Yuuki Saito (齋藤優輝)
- Kenji Katou (加藤賢二)
- Takahiro Furukawa (古川貴浩)
